intro: Psychotria subsessiliflora var. subsessiliflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved psychotria, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with ornamental and medicinal value. The plant features opposite, elliptical leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and often have a striking color contrast between the petals and sepals. It is often found in shaded, humid environments such as rainforests and understorey habitats.
